description: This quick salmon and broccoli dinner is packed with flavor, thanks to everything bagel seasoning, caramelized red onion, and capers.
headline: Everything Bagel Salmon with Broccoli and Capers

HowtoTip.text: Storage: Leftovers can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 2 days.

name: Everything Bagel Salmon with Broccoli and Capers
recipeIngredient: 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, divided

recipeInstructions.text: Cut 1 pound broccoli into bite-sized florets. Halve and thinly slice 1 medium red onion. Pat 4 salmon fillets dry with paper towels, then season on both sides with 1/2 teaspoon of the kosher salt and 1/4 teaspoon of the black pepper.

Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a large nonstick skillet with a lid over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add the salmon skin-side up and sear until golden-brown on the bottom, about 4 minutes.

Transfer the salmon skin-side down to a plate (it will not be cooked through). Add the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil to the pan. Add the broccoli, red onion, remaining 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Sauté until the broccoli is crisp-tender, 5 to 6 minutes. Meanwhile, sprinkle 2 tablespoons everything bagel seasoning on top of the salmon, pressing it gently to adhere.

Reduce the heat to medium. Stir 2 tablespoons capers into the pan. Return the salmon skin-side down to the pan, nestling it into the broccoli. Cover and cook the salmon to desired doneness, 2 to 5 minutes depending on the thickness of the fillets. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the middle of the thickest fillet should register 120°F to 130°F for medium-rare or 135°F to 145°F if you prefer it more well-done.
